page.title: 08Employment Express Dairy
page.content: The Express Dairy Whittington is an important part of local employment because 250 people work there all the shifts.The Dairy does not produce its own cheese although they add herbs and pack it.Large blocks of cheese are delivered to the Dairy weighing about 40 pounds.Each block is worth Â£40 to Â£60.These blocks are pushed through cheese wires which cut them into smaller blocks.Some of the cheese is grated,herbs are added and then it is pressed and packed.They are then kept in a coldstore until they are dispatched.Yoghurts and cheesecakes are made by large and noisy machines.Empty cartons are placed at the back of the machine which turns and adds the ingredients of biscuit crumbs,fruit and whipped cream for the cheesecakes or fruit for the yoghurts.
